title: Ticket #3562: Problems building HTCondor on Ubuntu 12
description: HTCondor has not been building on Ubuntu 12 in the Batlab. It is now being built successfully, although the changes feel like a hack and it is not clear that my solution is any good. This ticket is being made to track changes made that explicitly support building HTCondor on Ubuntu 12.
remarks:
2013-Apr-03 09:44:31 by nwp:
First problem is that the linker on Ubuntu 12 uses the --as-needed flag by default. Inserting --no-as-needed allowed the create_unstripped step to complete.

2013-Apr-03 09:45:57 by nwp:
Second problem is that the package step is calling fakeroot make, but then the make was calling fakeroot ... and nested execution of fakeroot is not allowed there. This allowed the create_native step to finish.

2013-Apr-03 11:26:23 by nwp:
Pushed to master. NMI Run 113978 looks green.
check_ins: 2013-Apr-03 11:20   Check-in [35321]: Get HTCondor to build on Ubuntu 12 in batlab #3562 Do --no-as-needed flag in link line, as Ubuntu 12 uses --as-needed by default; this causes create_unstripped to fail. Don't run "fakeroot make" (By Nathan W. Panike )
